results.title: ‘They Were Conned’: How Reckless Loans Devastated a Generation of Taxi Drivers
results.abstract: Thousands of immigrants who were chasing the dream of owning a New York taxi were trapped in reckless loans by bankers who made huge profits, The Times found.

results.title: As Thousands of Taxi Drivers Were Trapped in Loans, Top Officials Counted the Money
results.abstract: The government profited and looked away as thousands of immigrant taxi drivers in New York were ravaged by exploitative loans.

Office of the Comptroller of the Currency

results.title: The Last Chapter of bookbook: A Greenwich Village Institution Closes
results.abstract: After 35 years on Bleecker Street, the store will close by the end of this month. But the owners will still ply their wares at a nearby farmer’s market — and at a pickle stand.

results.title: Are Surfer Cafes and Green Markets What a Working-Class Beach Neighborhood Needs?
results.abstract: Sleepy Arverne is attracting entrepreneurs from its neighbor to the west, Rockaway Beach. As gentrification there continues, the community adjusts to the spotlight.

results.title: Where Are the Statues of L.G.B.T.Q. Pioneers? Here Are 11 Worthy New Yorkers
results.abstract: Virtually nonexistent among the city’s monuments, L.G.B.T.Q. men and women have made outsize contributions to New York’s identity. It is long past time they were put on a pedestal.
des_facet: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships

results.title: De Blasio Once Ignored Trump. But in Iowa, It Was All Trump.
results.abstract: The mayor made his first trip to Iowa as a presidential candidate, showing off his new focus on criticizing Mr. Trump.

multimedia.caption: Mayor Bill de Blasio toured an ethanol plant in Gowrie, Iowa, on Friday with former Iowa governor Tom Vilsack. “The Trump administration has favored big petroleum companies and that has to end,” Mr. de Blasio said after the tour.
multimedia.copyright: Christopher Smith for The New York Times

results.title: A Hotbed for Lacrosse? Harlem Makes Its Case
results.abstract: Frederick Douglass Academy in Harlem is playing for its third straight New York City boys’ lacrosse title. The team is a sign of progress for a sport seen as elite, suburban and mostly white.

results.title: Nxivm Trial: Naked Meetings and Photos for Sex Cult ‘Grandmaster’
results.abstract: Lauren Salzman, a senior member of the group, described how women would array themselves naked in front of the group’s founder as he sat in a chair and lectured.

multimedia.caption: Lauren Salzman leaving Federal District Court in Brooklyn last fall. “I was a slave with Keith as my master,” Ms. Salzman, 42, said in testimony on Friday. “I had other slaves under me.”
multimedia.copyright: Bebeto Matthews/Associated Press

results.title: Kirsten Gillibrand Is Struggling. Will Abortion Rights Be Her Rallying Cry?
results.abstract: The New York senator is mired near the bottom of most polls but hopes to jump-start her campaign and fund-raising as she aggressively criticizes anti-abortion laws in Alabama and other states.

results.title: In the Hamptons, Modernism Rises (Again)
results.abstract: Instead of classic beach houses with cedar shingles, developers are building more sleek, contemporary homes with flat roofs and lots of glass.
